statement:
If the functions $u_1(z)$, $u_2(z)$, … are in the domain
$G \subseteq\mathbb{C}$ and $$u_1(z) \le u_2(z) \le \cdots$$ in every
point of $G$, then $\lim_{n\to\infty}u_n(z)$ either is infinite in every
point of the domain or it is finite in every point of the domain, in
both cases in each subdomain of $G$. In the latter case, the function
$u(z) = \lim_{n\to\infty}u_n(z)$ is harmonic in the domain $G$ (cf.
limit function of sequence).
